intro: Sidalcea sulcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf checker-mallow, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their showy blooms and cotton-like fibers. Sidalcea sulcata is often found in California and Oregon, where it thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments.
